context: Is the flap control a 3-way rotating lever, or an up/middle/down switch? I currently use one of the levers from a throttle quadrant as a flap control.
response: The Flap lever is a two position momentary switch that steps through the flap positions available for the aircraft in use.  In this sense it is very similar to what you would set in the real aircraft and makes the control more realistic.  Select either flaps movement upward or downward.

response: The numlock key will enable/disable all of the secondary functions on the keypad. Press it once, and you've got up, down, left and right as well as End, Home, PU and PD... Press again and the keypad is enabled.
